articles.author: Megan Cerullo
articles.title: Traveled to China lately? Forget going on a cruise
articles.description: Cruise lines are banning guests and crew members who have been to China within the past 14 days over virus concerns.
articles.content:
U.S. and foreign cruise lines are now denying boarding to guests and crew members who have recently been in China over fears that their ships could contribute to the spread of the deadly coronavirus.  
The move comes after a number of cruise operators suspen… [+1919 chars]

articles.author: Kate Gibson
articles.title: Twitter bans Zero Hedge for coronavirus conspiracy post
articles.description: Finance blog published article pushing misleading idea that a Chinese researcher might be to blame for outbreak.
articles.content:
The financial website Zero Hedge is now barred from Twitter after publishing an article relaying a conspiracy theory that a Chinese scientist might be to blame for the coronavirus outbreak.
Zero Hedge on Friday wrote that Twitter had notified the site that i… [+2159 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Coronavirus cases in U.S. rises to 11
articles.description: There are three new confirmed cases of coronavirus in California, south of San Francisco. The total number of cases in the U.S. is now 11. According to a new report, there are more than 17,000 cases worldwide. Ramy Inocencio reports that the death toll in Chi…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: 11 of the 17,000 cases of the new coronavirus are in the U.S.
articles.description: But as the figures rise fast and the 1st death is confirmed outside China, the U.S. government has declared a public health emergency and cut travel links.
articles.content: Secretary of Defense Mark Esper on Saturday approved a request from the Department of Health and Human Services for housing support for "1,000 people who may need to be quarantined" due to the coronavirus, according to a Defense Department press release. The … [+1300 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: First death outside of China from the coronavirus confirmed in the Philippines
articles.description: The Philippine government on Sunday confirmed the first death outside China from the coronavirus. Meanwhile in China, nearly 60 million people are on lockdown while the Chinese government is facing scrutiny for a lack of transparency and underreporting the on…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: U.S. citizens returning home from China's Hubei province face mandatory quarantines
articles.description: Americans returning home from China's Hubei province will undergo a mandatory quarantine lasting as long as two weeks. Non-U.S. citizens who have recently been in areas impacted by the coronavirus will be temporarily suspended from entering the U.S. The CDC s…
